intro: Tibetia himalaica, commonly known as the Himalayan tibetia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has adapted to the cold, harsh climates of its native habitat. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a pale yellow or white color. Tibetia himalaica is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
